name: Higo Bloiko
description:
From Readme.txt:

Higo Bloiko
By Daniel Povey

Palokoma is a duck-thing that can wield tools & respawn at her nest. Armed with a single torch, Palokoma must venture into the dark, spike-ridden Tube Cave to save her Palokomettes, who wandered inside while she was sleeping! Here you'll find semi-hard areas, torch-dampening water & blind cave lizards who talk.

Higo Bloiko was made in Godot for the Optical Game Jam #4 over on itch.io, where we had to make a game based on a given picture (see below) within a single week.

The name comes from a random line in the sound poem "Karawane" by Hugo Ball, back when I had no idea where I was going with this project, and because I have trouble naming things. "Palokoma" is a completely made up word.

Working on this project made me confront some gaps in my understanding of the Godot engine, which is why it's a bit rough around the edges. Though it's not as well written as I hoped it'd be, I'm glad that I got to learn some more things about Godot.

Enjoy.

#################################################################################

Controls

Left & right arrow keys to walk.
Up arrow key to jump. Hold down to control jump strength.
Z to talk to lizards & collect Palokomettes. You can only carry one at a time.
X to bring up a window that displays time, and remaining Palokomettes.
F1 to change the window size. The max is determined by your screen resolution.
Escape to quit.
